channel.title: Beginner question
channel.description: Hello, I am going to attempt to make an updater. I would just like to know where to start. Aside from BCEL. Im learning that at the moment. Any help would be appreciated. Yes i know that no one will spoon feed me, but just a few pointers on how to get started would be appreciated.

item.title: Beginner question
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Thanks for helping me.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 06, 2008, 12:18:37 am[/size][hr]OK, so i hooked RSString, i know, no big accomplishment, but i have another question. how do you hoold fields, like how the 523 cc.ib is getLength(); Do you just look for patterns in the Byte-Code?

Read full topic

item.title: Beginner question
item.dc:creator: @Metho_D Method
item.description:
@Metho_D wrote:

zyle1992:

OK thanks. Just another question. How do you “hook the fields”? Do you just look for patterns in the byte code? Like hooking the 523 cc to RSString. Do you just look for whichever class implements the class that has no fields, no methods, and extends Object (AKA an essentially empty class, AKA Interface2)?

I think most people look for a class that has 1 interface and also contains the toString() and hashCode() methods. There shouldn’t be any other class with those characteristics, so it’s pretty easy to hook.

Read full topic

item.title: Beginner question
item.dc:creator: @nueb35 Nueb35
item.description:
@nueb35 wrote:

qauters:

There are a few people with updaters made from my old updater output’s, who don’t know what most of the fields mean.

im one of those >.>

ontopic : you should take a look at the bcel tutorials in the java section, and for your updater try to hook the easy fields first and see how it all works, (StringWrapper)

Read full topic

item.title: Beginner question
item.dc:creator: @qauters qauters
item.description:
@qauters wrote:

You will need a decent knowledge of java itself and a good knowledge of the jvm and it’s instructions.
I suggest once you learned these, to look at some old updaters. There where a few published in the past (Ollie’s, Frank_'s and PSB’s are good to see).

The most important thing is that you know what you want to get from the client. There are a few people with updaters made from my old updater output’s, who don’t know what most of the fields mean. Create your updater wisely and use it in order to develop a bot rather then showing off.

Useful link for jvm instructions info: http://en.wikibooks.org/wiki/Java_Programming/Byte_Code

Read full topic

item.title: Beginner question
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

http://java.sun.com/docs/books/tutorial/java/concepts/

http://java.sun.com/docs/books/jvms/

http://java.sun.com/docs/books/jvms/second_edition/html/ClassFile.doc.html

http://www.javaranch.com/journal/200408/ScjpTipLine-javap.html

Read them all, then you will have no problems. even read the more simple ones as they give a VERY VERY good base to learn from.

Read full topic
